results.title: Foods: fads and facts
results.brief_description: Discusses the effects of pesticides, preservatives and additives on foods and illustrates how government authorities maintain adequate safety levels on foods through constant supervision of food marketing. Also considers whether organic foods have any more nutritional value than foods grown with help of scientific knowledge. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Food: the story of a peanut butter sandwich
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, International Cinemedia Center and George Kaczender
results.brief_description: At a children’s party a contest is held to see who can make the most interesting sandwich. The popularity of peanut butter leads to an inquiry into food processing, its mechanics and economics. The filmmaker poses questions to the children about the origin of food, especially peanut butter, filling in the historical, geographic, cultural and other factors.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Learning Corporation of America, International Cinemedia Center and George Kaczender

results.title: Food: a multi-cultural feast
results.brief_description: Written by Jeffrey Schrank, the main tenet of this video is that taste is a cultural bias - you eat/enjoy what your culture teaches you is edible/enjoyable and similarly reject as inedible what your culture rejects too. So what may make a person from one culture gag (monkey brains, haggis, raw fish, sheep eyeballs, cheese, frog’s legs, pigs feet etc) yet become delicacies in another culture? The program also looks at the physical/philosophical differences of how we eat. The second half provides an interesting look at the multi-cultural origins of many foods that have became part of the American national diet and its identity as well as looking at the influence of slaves, native Americans and immigrants on the eating habits of Americans.

results.title: Food Victoria: a whole world of food (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: Food Victoria, Victorian Dairy Industry Authority and Multimedia Victoria
results.brief_description: Victoria produces a third of Australia’s raw and processed food. The multimedia interactive program is divided into four sections: Victoria, Dairy, Stone Fruit and a Directory based on a supermarket interface. A wealth of information with excellent graphics and video presentations.

results.title: Food that builds good health
results.brief_description: A young boy called Art is not eating a balanced diet, so is weak and lethargic. A school demonstration with two guinea pigs on different diets convinces Art that he should change his eating habits.
